N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12§§ 12-1.4 - Prevention of air contamination

State Regulations
(a) General. All operations or processes
which produce air contaminants shall be so conducted that the generation, release or dissemination of such air contaminants is kept at the lowest
practicable level in compliance with this Part (rule) using proper control or
protective procedures and equipment. All equipment used to effect compliance
with this Part (rule) shall be maintained in good condition and in accordance
with the requirements of the Labor Law and of the Industrial Code. (b) Responsibility of employers. (1)

Every employer shall effect compliance
with the provisions of this Part (rule) relating to the prevention and removal
of air contaminants, the storage and use of flammable liquids and the
provision, installation, operation and maintenance of control or protective
equipment. (2)

Every employer shall
instruct his employees as to the hazards of their work, the use of the control
or protective equipment and their responsibility for complying with the
provisions of this Part (rule). (3)

No employer shall suffer or permit an employee to work in a room in which there
exist dangerous air contaminants in a work atmosphere. (4)

No employer shall suffer or permit
dangerous air contaminants to accumulate or remain in any place or area subject
to the provisions of this Part (rule). (c) Responsibility of employees. Every
employee shall use the control and protective equipment provided for his
protection and shall comply with all provisions of this Part (rule) relating to
his personal conduct. Notes
